page.title: 13PARISH CHURCH ALRESFORD
page.content: The main church in Alresford is the Church of England, St.John the Baptist. Originally Norman, the present building was erected in 1689 and restored in 1898. It is large enough to seat 324 people and also about 50 choir members. The nearby Perin's School uses the church for its annual Carol Service.The present vicar is the Reverend Trasler. There is a church hall which caters for numerous groups and meetings.The church Tower provides a superb view of the surrounding countryside. In the churchyard are to be found the gravestones of several French Prisoners of War, who, along with 200 others were on parole in Alresford between 1808 and 1814. The church at Old Alresford is St. Mary the Virgin, built in 1753. With 32 pews and 4 choir stalls of wood.
